thread.title: Netanyahu in silent protest at UN over Iran deal
thread.title_full: Netanyahu in silent protest at UN over Iran deal | News24

author: news24.com
title: Netanyahu in silent protest at UN over Iran deal
text:
New York - Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu savaged the nuclear deal with Iran, falling silent for nearly a minute at the United Nations on Thursday in protest and offering to resume direct peace talks with the Palestinians.
Netanyahu addressed the General Assembly as he sought to repair relations with President Barack Obama, damaged by the Iran deal and the Israeli leader's rejection, while seeking re-election, of a two-state solution.
He held up a book by Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, calling it a detailed plan for the destruction of Israel, and saying that he had vowed that Israel would not exist in 25 years' time.
"Seventy years after the murder of six million Jews, Iran's rulers promise to destroy my country, murder my people, and the response from this body, the response from nearly every one of the governments represented here has been absolutely nothing," he said.
